column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Chiba
#Text=Chiba ( 千葉 ) is the largest city in Chiba prefecture , Japan .
#Text=Practically speaking , it can be considered a large suburb of Tokyo .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Oyumino is not so big and is more a suburb surrounded by a lot of nature .
#Text=There are many beautiful parks and nature trails .
#Text=By contrast , development of Oyumino has been proceeded at the same time .
#Text=Every year , the number of new housings and shopping centres increases rapidly .
#Text=Chiba is where the anime Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai ( 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない , lit .

column3: 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない

column1: #Text=My Little Sister Ca n't Be This Cute ) takes place , and you can see the Chiba Urban Monorail in the opening of the anime .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The JR Narita Line links Chiba directly to Narita 's international airport .
#Text=A few N'EX limited expresses stop at Chiba on their way to Tokyo , but usually the ordinary rapid service trains are a better bet .
#Text=By train
#Text=Train is the obvious means of arrival , as a dense web of routes links Chiba to Tokyo and points in the vicinity .
#Text=The JR Sōbu Rapid Line ( 総武快速線 ) runs from Tokyo Station 's underground platforms to Chiba station via Kinshichō and Tsudanuma .

#Text=Rapid trains reach Chiba in approximately 40 minutes at a cost of ¥ 620 ; you have the option , especially during the evening rush , of shelling out an additional ¥ 810 for a reserved seat on a limited express train , which make the run to Chiba in as little as 25 minutes .
#Text=The JR Chuō-Sōbu Local Line ( 中央・総武線「各駅停車 」 ) runs directly across the Yamanote Line loop , via Shinjuku and Akihabara .

column3: 中央・総武線「各駅停車

column1: #Text=Local trains take about 70 minutes to reach Chiba from Shinjuku on a regular service ; this is shaved a little if you change to a Sobu Rapid train at Kinshicho .
#Text=In either case the fare is ¥ 780 .

#Text=The JR Keiyō Line ( 京葉線 ) runs from Tokyo Station to Chiba Minato and Soga stations along the coast ( 45 minutes , ¥ 740 ) , via Maihama ( Tokyo Disneyland ) , Nishi-Funabashi and Kaihin-Makuhari .
#Text=The private Keisei Chiba Line ( 京成千葉線 ) runs into Chiba-Chuō ( 千葉中央 ) station from Tsudanuma station on the Keisei Main Line ( from Ueno and Nippori ) .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Airport Limousine buses link Chiba to Haneda and Narita Airports .
#Text=By monorail

#Text=The two lines of the suspended Chiba Urban Monorail ( 千葉都市モノレール ) , the world 's longest suspended monorail , are an attraction in themselves , connecting the port ( 千葉みなと Chiba Minato ) to Chiba station and then branching out to the northwest and northeast .
#Text=See
#Text=Chiba Port Tower ( 千葉ポートタワー ) .
#Text=10 minutes on foot from monorail and Keiyo line Chiba Minato station .

#Text=Towers like this are a fixture of any self-respecting Japanese city , and here the observation deck ( 112m ) offers views of the surrounding industrial wastelands and container docks , at least for a kilometer or two until they fade off in the smog .

#Text=There is also a curious display of stuffed fish mounted on sticks in a simulated ocean environment downstairs ; the simulation is needed since heavily polluted Chiba Bay has n't sustained anything above seaweed for quite a while .
#Text=Entry ¥ 410 , open daily from 9AM to 7PM ( or 9PM in summer ) .
#Text=Chiba Castle ( 千葉城 chiba-jō ; 亥鼻城 inohana-jō ) ( about 5 – 10 minutes walk from the Kenchomae Chiba Urban Monorail station ) .
#Text=A reconstruction , but it does look quite cool- just try to ignore the fluorescent tubes inside !
#Text=It hosts the city Folk Museum .
#Text=Aoba no Mori Koen ( 青葉の森公園 ) ( 10mins walk from the Keisei Chiba line station Chibadera ) .
#Text=( Blue Leaf Forest Park ) .
#Text=Nothing too spectacular , but during the Sakura ( Cherry blossom ) season a nice place to get away from the concrete jungle .
#Text=Comic markets .
#Text=Very great place for anime likers and otaku !
#Text=There are many anime events held and also there are anime shops .
#Text=Foreigners would surely love this place .
#Text=Just stop by and see many kinds of Japanese animes .
#Text=Kaihin-Makuhari

#Text=On the western outskirts of the city in Mihama Ward and accessible on the JR Keiyo line ( Kaihin-Makuhari Station , 海浜幕張駅 ) , this is a showcase " city of the future " , similar to Tokyo 's Odaiba but grander and more artificial in scope .
#Text=Makuhari Messe ( 幕張メッセ ) .
#Text=Also known as the Nippon Convention Center , this is the largest convention center in the Tokyo region .
#Text=Makuhari Techno Garden ( 幕張テクノガーデン ) .

#Text=An impressive complex of shopping malls , restaurants and office towers ; white tile , glass and polished steel with atmospheric lighting and realistic plastic plants , with footsteps echoing in the quiet walkways and aerial bridges .
#Text=Chiba Marine Stadium ( 千葉マリンスタジアム ) .

column3: 千葉マリンスタジアム

column1: #Text=Home to the Chiba Lotte Marines baseball team .
#Text=Its 30,000 seats also host events and converts , including the annual Summer Sonic Festival in August , drawing big-name musical acts from around the globe .
#Text=Mitsui Outlet Park Makuhari ( 三井アウトレットパーク 幕張 ) ( close to the Kaihin-makuhari Station ) .

column3: 三井アウトレットパーク

column1: #Text=There are lots of shops including such major brands as Coach , Edwin , Nike , and so on .
#Text=During special events or holiday seasons like Christmas the sales draw large crowds .
#Text=For people who want to enjoy shopping with their pets , some shops have special areas that pets can enjoy .
#Text=Costco(コストコ幕張倉庫店 )
#Text=In Japan , there are few Costcos , and one of them is in Makuhari .
#Text=This way of displaying items is uncommon in Japan , so many people are interested in it and go there .
#Text=Entering the building can be done without a membership card if entering at a busy time ; the only time memberships are absolutely checked for is at the cash register .
#Text=For some Japanese , the items are too big or too much , so people like to divide the items with others .
#Text=To get there , you can take bus from Kaihin-makuhari or Shin-Narashino Station .
#Text=It costs ¥ 100 and takes 5 minutes .
#Text=Bay Town ( 幕張ベイタウン ) ( Heiwa Koutsu Bus or Keisei Bus from Kaihin-Makuhari , ¥ 150 ) .
#Text=The view of town is very modern and constructions are very colorful .
#Text=It 's not so common in this area , so some TV shows in Japan use this town as a location .
#Text=You can buy houses or rent them .
#Text=Oyumino
#Text=Four seasons roads ( 四季の道 )
#Text=There are four nature trails named Spring Road , Summer Road , Autumn Road and Winter Road .
#Text=If you go to Spring Road in spring , you can enjoy beautiful flowers and plants bloom in spring .
#Text=Some people just walk through and some people jog in these roads .
#Text=Sakura Park ( さくら公園 ) is a park which has many beautiful cherry blossom trees .
#Text=When spring comes , a lot of people come to enjoy seeing them .
#Text=Izumiya park ( 泉谷公園 ) has fireflies in this park , but you cannot see them often because they have been protected carefully .
#Text=Oyumino fireworks festival ( おゆみ池花火大会 ) is one of the biggest festivals in Oyumino and is held in August every year .
#Text=About 3500 fireworks are launched , and countless viewers enjoy dancing and having traditional foods there .
#Text=Rokutsu Temple ( 六通神社 ) was built in 1677 ( the Edo era ) .
#Text=At that time , many farmers tried to develop this area and building the temple was one of their activities .
#Text=It is not so huge but has been loved by local people .
#Text=In September 2007 , Chiba was hit by a typhoon , and the temple was destroyed , but people living in the area decided to use the community chest for its restoration .
#Text=Finally , it was repaired and reborn by local people .
#Text=It has been a symbol of Oyumino and is still cherished .
